content.description: Traverses up and right to the start of Royal Flush
content.location: Starts behind a large pine tree even with and 50 feet to the right of the small cone base.

content.description: After the steep start follow the climbing of the water streak to the anchor.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the gully right of the small cone boulder.

content.description: Starts at the slab of Cocao Free Blues and angles left to romp up even more slabby climbing.
content.protection: Few bolts and gear to coldshuts.

content.description: Great movement up the blocky, changing corners and past the horizontal seams onto the ramp above.  Use the midway anchor or bring a few pieces of small gear to finish the short crack to the top anchor.
Ascends the steep water groove through two overhangs.
content.location: Use the Traverse Pitch to access the start, which is about 200 feet right of the Thieving Dingus Gully.

content.description: Make the airy step left onto the wall and follow the large edges upwards. At top the direct finish above the last bolt is 5.10a/b, traversing right towards the small pine is 5.9
content.location: Starts 10 feet left of the small cone summit located at the base of the wall.

climbs.name: Putain is not French for Piton

content.description: A few steep jugs lead to easier climbing before committing to the final crux moves.  Can be climbed using 5.11 or 5.10 moves.
Steep, thin crack.
content.protection: Bolts, small nuts, and cams to coldshuts.
content.location: Starts 30 feet right of Badger Tracks.

content.description: Overhanging start to a second short steep section.  Follow easier rock up.
content.protection: 8 bolts and possibly some gear on easier climbing to coldshuts.
content.location: Starts 30 feet right of Sex at Noon Taxes.

content.description: Pull the steep start and move up the thin, overlapping bulges above.
content.location: Starts 20 feet down and left of Red Mite at a steep undercut.

content.description: Climbs the left side of the small cone that sits at the base of the wall.

content.location: Starts 60 feet left of the large, right-leaning dihedral, which is Just Another Saturday Night.

content.description: Step onto wall, pass two horizontal seams, pull into the scoop, and follow the right edge of the steep varnished wall.
content.location: Starts from the top of small cone at the base of the wall.

content.description: Enjoy the jugs on the overhanging start and get those feet established above the roof.  Follow easier rock up.
content.location: Starts 20 feet left of Sex at Noon Taxes.

content.description: Step right onto wall, pass two horizontal seams, pull onto the headwall, and move through the small alcove below the small triangular overhang.
content.location: Starts from the top of small cone at the base of the wall.

content.description: Climb up 20 feet and move right into the dihedral. Enjoy the stemming to the top.
content.location: Climbs the large right-facing dihedral that starts 20 feet off the ground.

content.description: Easy climbing up a ramp and past a coffee table sized boulder to the high first bolt.  Traverse left into the right-facing dihedral.  Crux is in the first 3 bolts after which stemming in the dihedral is your friend.
content.protection:
9 bolts to open shuts.

Anchor has 2 open shuts and a 3rd cold shut over the lip on top of the ledge. Bring a long sling to clip this for a 3-point top roping anchor.
content.location: I believe this is the furthest left route on the wall at this time (5/2014). Locate a 100' tall pillar left of a more obvious, larger overhanging pillar.  This climbs the right-facing dihedral on the left side.

content.description: Step onto the wall, pass two horizontal seams, and follow the left edge of the steep varnished wall. Finishes on Red Mite anchor or can trend right to Kaying anchor.
content.protection: 9 bolts to shared anchor at top of Leading Edge.
content.location: Starts from the top left side of the small cone at the base of the wall.

content.description: Pass to the right of the overhang on the slabby tongue of rock and continue up the arete.
content.location: Starts 10 feet left of the large, right-leaning dihedral, which is Just Another Saturday Night.

content.description: Follow the steepening cracks to reach the top of the flake ledge. Pass the Beta Licker anchor at 80 feet to continue up and delicately move left to gain the larger holds on the skyline. Climbing only the first 80 feet to Beta Licker anchor is 5.10+.
content.location: Starts just right of a large pine tree, 40 feet left of the large, right-leaning dihedral.

climbs.name: Dinging of Dented McGee
climbs.fa: Horning, Rosen, Captain America, Ms. America

content.description: Follows the crack system through the roof located 20 feet above the ground. Continue up the crack system.
content.location: Starts 10 feet left of the large, right-leaning dihedral.

content.description: Climbs the short slab and fires out the short headwall splitter crack feature.

climbs.name: Cloudy With A Chance Of Lichening

content.description:
To keep this at 5.7, the direct start climbs the steeper slab just left of pine tree to the high first bolt just under the small (1') roof. Step through the small roof and continue up the center of the licheny slab and continue into the right-facing dihedral with a couple bushes.

Route can be climbed at 5.6 by taking ramp to left and stepping right around the small roof after clipping the first 2 bolts.

Named for the rumbling thunder while bolting the route and slippery lichen on the FA.
content.protection: About 8 bolts to cold shut/carabiner anchor.
content.location: One of the furthest left routes on the wall at this time (5/2014). Locate a 100' tall pillar left of a more obvious, larger overhanging pillar. Start just downhill of a pine tree where raspberry stems are coming out of a horizontal crack at waist height.  Or for the 5.6 start, go up the ramp to the left.

content.description: Start on steep, unobvious rock to move up to the right side of the slabby ramp; fun, airy traverse left to reach the arete.
content.protection: All bolts to shared anchor with Abstract Realty.
content.location: Starts on right side of the 40-foot wide slabby ramp that begins 15 feet off the ground.

content.description: Just right of Sex at Noon Taxes, angle right across the slabby panel and continue up.
content.location: Starts a few feet right of Sex at Noon Taxes

content.description: Slab up to the overhang then power and finesse into the open dihedral. Work your way past the second overhang to reach the anchor. The popular option of linking the Beta Licker to the end of the Down Converter has been dubbed Beta Converter, 12a, which provides three distinct cruxes.
content.location: Starts 20 feet left of the large, right-leaning dihedral.

content.description: Starts on steep rock in the gully just to the right of the small cone. Pass the two horizontal seams and continue straight up to anchor.
Where you gonna fall ... when you realize ... you just can't have it all.  Climbs a series of sidepull/layback flakes up questionable rock.  Belay off to the side.
content.location: Starts just left of a large pine tree, 50 feet left of the large, right-leaning dihedral, which is Just Another Saturday Night.

content.description:
Badger Tracks is three pitches that trend up and right to reach the summit ramp. Can be used to access the start of Eat a Lotta Peaches, which ascends the right side of the large Cornerstone Block at the skyline.

P1:10b, Slab up and right to short open book headwall. Grab on and pull down ... (All bolts to open shuts, 70')

P2:10a, Ascend the hand crack corner and then step/traverse right (All bolts to cold shuts, 40')

P3:10, Climb the face (probably all bolts ... to cold shuts, 95')
content.protection: First two pitches all bolts. Third pitch probably all bolts. Open- and coldshuts.
content.location: Starts 60 feet right of Sex at Noon Taxes.

content.description: Start on steep rock, move into the short shallow dihedral, work right to the arete and continue up.
content.location: Starts directly below the large, right-facing dihedral.

content.description: Climbs the steep headwall above and to the right of Just Another Saturday Night. If you need beta, ask the man in black over a breakfast beer.

Sage advice from the Reverend Sport Trindleberg, "Fear, like pain, may just be GodÂ’s way of hurting us."

Climbs straight up from the top of Kaying or Ben's Barbeque and then trends right along a shallow seam to pass over the steep overlap.
Laird
Horning.
Climb steep crack on the headwall above Just Another Saturday Night. The climbing is more fun than an accidental frontal lobotomy.
content.location: Starts from ledge above Just Another Saturday Night.

content.description: Second pitch above Poverty of Ambition
Climbs the shallow crack system that splits the dark brown varnished rock on the steep right side of the Cornerstone Block.
content.location: Access the start from the third pitch of Badger Tracks.

content.description: Moves up and left from the top of Kaying to fire up a weakness in the short, steep, dark brown wall above.
Climbs the crack on the left side of the large Cornerstone Block at the skyline.
content.location: Second pitch.

content.description: Second pitch.
Second pitch.

pathTokens: Laramie Peak Wildlife Habitat Management Area
